Dear Lauren Skinner:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM,
and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately please contact the area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer at (517) 899-6024.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention: (a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to: (ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 3/24/25, while a youth was placed at the facility, a verbal
altercation occurred between the youth and a staff member. The
staff member started to choke the youth while the other youth
watched.
Investigation Interviews:
On 04/02/2025 an email was sent to the assigned FCW. He was
advised of allegations and asked to provide feedback regarding
Youth A and any concerns with his placement at Wolverine. FCW
responding with case history information, denied having any
concerns with the agency and did not have any additional
information to share.
On 04/02/2025 a telephone conversation was held with DHHS
Specialist. She confirmed that Complainant was anonymous,
but stated she was able to make contact via telephone number
documented in the within the complaint report. She further
advised that it was believed that the incident occurred on 3/14/25
at the school on Wolverine grounds. Complainant did not witness
the incident first hand, but recalled hearing commotion.
Complainant said that Teacher said that Youth A was acting out,
pushed Staff 1 and then Staff 1 choked Youth A. Complainant
was not sure if video footage was available and indicated that
Youth A was not injured. DHHS Specialist also advised that she
had spoken with FCW who stated that Youth A denied being
choked or harmed while at Wolverine.
On 04/02/2025 attempted telephone call was made to
Complainant at number documented in the complaint report; there
was no answer. The complainant is listed as anonymous in the
DCWL complaint.
2

On 04/02/2025 an onsite visit was completed to Wolverine to
initiate the special investigation. DHHS Specialist accompanied
me to the agency.
The following interviews took place at Wolverine on
04/02/2025 along with the DHHS Specialist, unless otherwise
noted.
An interview was completed with Teacher. She could not recall
the date of the incident but recalled that Youth A was being very
aggressive toward other youth and staff that day. She said that
Youth A was “getting into the face” of both youth and staff and
pushing people. Teacher stated it seemed that Youth A was
upset about something. Staff 1 was attempting to redirect Youth A
and asked him to stop using profanity and Staff 1 told Youth A he
was not going to “put his hands on nobody”. Teacher reported
that Youth A responded to Staff 1 and said “I will put my hands on
you” and proceed to push Staff 1 into the doorway. She stated
that there was another staff present, but she could not remember
his name. Teacher stated that she and the students were in the
classroom and did not see what took place outside of the
classroom when Youth A and Staff 1 ended up in the hallway.
She recalls that staff was called to assist with Youth A. Teacher
denied seeing Staff 1 or any other staff choke or abuse Youth A.
She did recall that when Youth A pushed Staff 1 that Staff 1 stood
in a protective stance. Again, she stated she did not see Staff 1
touch Youth A. She reported that she then closed the classroom
door in an attempt to restore some order. Teacher was unaware
about the status of the cameras in the hallway.
An interview was completed with Chief Administrator (CA). She
was advised of the allegations. She confirmed that Youth A had
been discharged from Wolverine on 3/17/2025. She advised me
and DHHS Specialist that there were no incident reports for Youth
A and Staff 1. She advised that Youth C was present while Youth
A was at the facility and attends on-grounds school. She reported
that Staff 1 had been placed on administrative leave as a result of
the investigation. A request was made for video footage, face
sheets, classroom attendance record and a list of staff present in
the school area on that day. A plan was made to return on
4/09/2025 for additional interviews.
On 04/04/2025 an email was received from CA. She advised that
she was not able to locate any documentation associated with the
3/14/2025 date and that Youth A was not onsite that day. I
3

responded and advised that the date may not be accurate and
requested any incident reports between March 1st and March 17th
when Youth A was discharged that involved Youth A and Staff 1.
CA responded on 04/07/2025 and advised that there were no
incident reports within those parameters.
The following interviews took place at Wolverine on
04/09/2025 along with the DHHS Specialist, unless otherwise
noted.
An interview was completed with Staff 1. He reported that Youth
A is often removed from class due to his behavior and trying to
fight others. He recalls that he has given verbal direction to Youth
A with success. He denied ever putting his hands on Youth A and
specifically denied choking him. He further stated he does not
recall the incident as reported and denies that Youth A ever
pushed him through a door. He also denied having to call for
assistance to handle Youth A on this date. Staff 1 stated there are
no cameras in the classroom but may be some in the hall. He
lastly denied that there have been any incidents between him and
Youth A and again denied every physically abusing or assaulting
Youth A.
An interview was completed with Supervisor. She reported there
has been no reports or concerns about Staff 1 from youth or any
other staff. She described Staff 1 as one of the best male staff
members at the agency. She also denied that Teacher had
expressed any concerns. She lastly advised that Youth A is often
isolated due to his aggressive behavior toward youth and staff.
An interview was completed with Youth B. He denied having any
concerns with Staff 1. He also denied witnessing any incidents
involving Staff 1 and Youth A. He denied seeing Staff 1 hit, choke
or physically abuse any youth at the agency and denied any
knowledge of Staff 1 abusing other youth. Youth B did report that
Staff 1 has put his hands on him “in a playful manner”. He was
not able to describe or provide an example. Youth B stated that
Staff 1 plays with all of the kids at the agency and when they don’t
like it, they go to the supervisor.
An interview was held with Youth C. DHHS Specialist 2
participated in the interview. Youth C confirmed he attends school
on grounds. He stated he recalled the day and that Youth A was
aggressive and fighting people for no reason. He reported that
Youth A was on a 1 to 1 and is sometimes on a 2 to 1. He denied
hearing anything about an incident between Youth A and Staff 1
4

and denied seeing Staff 1 choke Youth A. Youth C confirmed that
youth “play around” with staff all the time, but denied that they
ever get aggressive or that anyone is “choked”.
On 04/09/2025 an email was sent to CA. She was advised that
we had toured the classroom and hallway area and noticed the
cameras. A request was made for video footage during classroom
hours between 3/7/25 and 3/13/25, incident reports, copy of any
policy relevant to horseplaying and confirmation of whether or not
Youth a was on 1:1 or 2:1. She responding on 04/14/25 and
confirmed that Youth A was on 1:1 and 2:1 staff to youth
supervision during his time, advised that there was no policy
regarding horseplaying, provided copies of some incident reports
and advised that she was still working on the video.
On 05/04/2025 a return call was received from Staff 2. He
reported he arrived to work about ½ hour early and was asked to
monitor Youth A while another staff went to the restroom. He
noticed that Youth A looked frustrated and they talked about his
MP3 not working. Staff 2 stated the youth was sitting in the
stairwell of the hallway outside of the classroom. He stated that
Staff 1 said “something” to Youth A. He denied hearing what Staff
1 said, but knows that it triggered Youth A. Staff 2 reported Youth
A jumped up and stated “I’m tired of this nigga shit, he play too
much and I’m about to beat his ass”. While he was saying this,
Youth A was running toward Staff 1 and then clinched him by the
collar. Staff 2 stated Staff 1 was pushing Youth A back and
pushed him in the chest and grabbed his shirt. He denied that
they attempted to place Youth A in a restraint. Staff 2 reported
that Staff 1 said to Youth A, “let me the fuck go”. Staff 2 stated he
was able to convivence both Youth A and Staff 1 to let go of each
other. Staff 2 further reported that he was able to debrief with
Youth A and discuss the incident with him. He reported that Youth
A stated that Staff 1 “play too much and takes everything for a
joke”. Youth A was remorseful and later apologized to Staff 1.
Staff 2 denied that he wrote an incident report and said that “it
really wasn’t an incident”. Staff 2 confirmed that staff will attempt
to redirect youth using joking jesters. Staff 2 denied seeing Staff 1
“choke” Youth A or engaged in physical altercations with other
youth.
On 05/04/2025 and 05/16/2025 an attempt was made to contact
Youth D via telephone without success. A voicemail message
could not be left.
5

Video Review:
On 05/05/2025 a teams meeting was held with CA and Area
Manager. CA was able to share her screen and the video was
reviewed together. CA confirmed the names of the staff and youth
in the video. The video was very dark, but an altercation could be
seen occurring between what appeared to be a youth and a staff.
The youth pushed the staff in the chest area and the adult in the
video pushed the youth back. The interview with Staff 2 was used
to confirm who and what was being seen in the video.
Documents Reviewed:
SWC documenting interview of Youth A by DHHS Specialist 3 and
DCWL Worker 2 on 04/03/2025. It was documented that Youth A
said nothing ever happened to him at Wolverine. He described it
as another placement and stated he kept to himself. He denied
that anything inappropriate happened with staff and does not
know where that information would come from. Youth A was
specifically asked about information that staff had assaulted him
and he stated that staff had never hit him or choked him. Youth A
kept saying he didn't know why anyone would say that. He then
indicated that he did not want to talk about anything else.
SWC documenting Interview of Youth D by DHHS Specialist on
05/02/2025. DHHS Specialist attempted to interview Youth D via
telephone about the incident and he responded that he “did not
want to talk”.
Wolverine Behavior Management Policy:
All staff are to be certified in Crisis Prevention Institute Non-
Violent Crisis Intervention. Non-violent physical restrictions are
only to be used to protect clients or others from unanticipated or
severely aggressive behavior that places them at risk of violence
or injury if no intervention occurs. Interventions must be guided by
a number of factors, including safety of other clients and staff, size
and strength of client, degree of past violent behavior, whether the
client has a weapon, physical or health conditions of the client,
client's Individual Crisis Management Plan. Post-incident
debriefing must also occur.
Review of HR File of Staff 1 – He had documentation of a written
warning and 3 day suspension from October 15, 2024 for violation
of company rules, unsatisfactory work performance and violation
of safety rules. Staff 1 was also placed on administrative leave on
December 13, 2024 pending outcome of an investigation.
6

Tour of Agency:
On 04/09/2025 a tour of the school classroom and hallway
immediately outside of the area was reviewed. At the time of the
tour, there were two staff and the teacher in the classroom. There
were no concerns noted. Two cameras were confirmed to be in
the hallway area and the area was assessed to be well lit.
`Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in non-compliance with the licensing rule. Interviews were
completed and video was reviewed, and it was determined that
the staff violated the policy by pushing the youth and grabbing him
by his shirt.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following: (c)
Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care, safety, and
supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Agency failed to write an incident report.
Investigation Interviews:
On 04/02/2025 an interview was completed with Chief
Administration (CA). She was advised of the allegations. She
confirmed that Youth A had been discharged from Wolverine on
3/17/2025. She advised me and DHHS Specialist that there were
no incident reports for Youth A and Staff 1.
On 04/04/2025 an email was received from CA. She advised that
she was not able to locate any documentation associated with the
3/14/2025 date and that Youth A was not onsite that day. I
responded and advised that the date may not be accurate and
7

requested any incident reports between March 1st and March 17th
when Youth A was discharged that involved Youth A and Staff 1.
CA responded on 04/07/2025 and advised that there were no
incident reports within those parameters.
On 05/04/2025 a return call was received from Staff 2. Staff 2
denied that he wrote an incident report and said that “it really
wasn’t an incident”.
On 05/05/2025 a teams meeting was held with CA and Area
Manager. CA was asked about an incident report or behavior
notification form having been completed regarding the incident in
the classroom. She reported that no IR was completed because
nothing happened. She further referenced the challenges
associated with writing an IR for all of the actions of the youth
placed at Wolverine.
Video Review:
On 05/05/2025 a teams meeting was held with CA and Area
Manager. CA was able to share her screen and the video was
reviewed together. CA confirmed the names of the staff and youth
in the video. The video was very dark, but an altercation could be
seen occurring between what appeared to be a youth and a staff.
The youth pushed the staff in the chest area and the adult in the
video pushed the youth back. The interview with Staff 2 was used
to confirm who and what was being seen in the video.
Documents Reviewed:
Wolverine Incident Reporting Policy – It is the agency policy to
ensure safe, effective and transparent response to incidents of
critical nature. This policy must be consistently complied with in
order to facilitate communication and timely response from the
appropriate individuals. The list provides a guideline, but is not an
exhaustive list of incidents deemed critical. The lead staff
managing the incident is responsible for completing the
appropriate Incident Report in a clear, complete and accurate
manner. The appropriate form should be used to document the
incident, either the Incident Report Form or the Behavior
notification form. The policy provides some guidelines for when
an incident form or behavior notification form should be completed
(i.e. physical injury, AWOL, Arrest, Vehicle Accident, Suicidal
Behaviors/Gestures, Criminal Behavior and more). It specifies the
list is a guide and not an exhaustive list.
Analysis As a result of the interviews that were completed and video and
documents reviewed, it was confirmed that there was an incident
8

between Youth A and Staff 1 that should have been documented
via an incident report. Review of the agency incident reporting
policy indicates this incident should have been documented on
either the Incident Report Form or the Behavior Notification Form.
Neither form was completed or provided for review.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158: Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention: (a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to: (iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth's
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff used profanity toward youth at the facility.
Investigation Interviews:
On 05/04/2025 a return call was received from Staff 2. He stated
that Staff 1 said “something” to Youth A. He denied hearing what
Staff 1 said, but knows that it triggered Youth A. Staff 2 reported
Youth A jumped up and stated, “I’m tired of this nigga shit, he play
too much and I’m about to beat his ass”. While he was saying
this, Youth A was running toward Staff 1 and then clinched him by
the collar. Staff 2 stated Staff 1 was pushing Youth A back and
pushed him in the chest and grabbed his shirt. He denied that
they attempted to place Youth A in a restraint. Staff 2 reported
that Staff 1 said to Youth A, “let me the fuck go”
The video footage did not have audio.
An interview was completed with Staff 1 and he denied hitting or
cursing at Youth A.
9

An interview was completed with Supervisor, Youth B and Youth
A. None of them reported hearing Staff 1 use profanity toward
Youth A.
Documents Reviewed:
Wolverine Behavior Management Policy:
All staff are to be certified in Crisis Prevention Institute Non-
Violent Crisis Intervention. Non-violent physical restrictions are
only to be used to protect clients or others from unanticipated or
severely aggressive behavior that places them at risk of violence
or injury if no intervention occurs. Interventions must be guided by
a number of factors, including safety of other clients and staff, size
and strength of client, degree of past violent behavior, whether the
client has a weapon, physical or health conditions of the client,
client's Individual Crisis Management Plan. Post-incident
debriefing must also occur.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in compliance with the licensing rule. Interviews were completed
with both staff and youth, and there was not sufficient evidence to
confirm use of profanity toward Youth A by Staff 1.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. A corrective action plan is required.
